FuncDef: The reset user-group-queue statistics command clears the statistics about a specified GQ.
CLIs: reset user-group-queue [ name ] <group-name> statistics [ group <group-name> ] slot { <slot-id> | all } { inbound | outbound }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a shared group.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

Specifies the name of a user group queue.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

Specifies a slot number.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset user-group-queue test statistics slot all inbound
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
GQs fall into two types: board GQs and global GQs.
If the created GQ is a board GQ, you must specify the slot number of the board before you clear the statistics about the GQ. To clear the statistics about a specified GQ, run the reset user-group-queue [ name ] statistics slot { inbound | outbound } command.If the created GQ is a global GQ, you can either specify the slot number of the board or not before you clear the statistics about the GQ. To clear the statistics about a specified GQ, run the reset user-group-queue [ name ] statistics slot all { inbound | outbound } command.

Precautions
When mode template is configured for a GQ, the GQ is instantiated based on the group in the QoS profile. Therefore, you must specify a group name to clear the GQ statistics.
